alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chenango; Cortland; Tioga; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 17 at 10:45AM EST until November 17 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Broome County in central New York... Southern Cortland County in central New York... Northern Tioga County in central New York... Southern Tompkins County in central New York... Southwestern Chenango County in central New York... * Until 1130 AM EST. * At 1044 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Willet to near Enfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Ithaca, Newfield, Danby, Caroline, Nanticoke, Greene, Berkshire, Richford, Willet and Newark Valley. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 8 and 9. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
